```{r, echo=TRUE}
library(tidyverse)
library(epiDisplay)
library(scales) 
library(car)
library(sjmisc)

# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
#Load Opal R library
library(opal)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()
#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the LASA table(s) to your RStudio environment
# CLSA-COP0
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'CoP4_Baseline', 'CLSA_1.CoP4_Baseline', variables = 
list('K10_DSCORE_MCQ','K10_TIRED_MCQ','K10_NRVS_MCQ','K10_NRVSCLMD_MCQ','K10_HPLS_MCQ','K10_RSTLS_MCQ','K10_RSTLSSTL_MCQ','K10_DEP_MCQ','K10_EFFRT_MCQ','K10_NOCHRUP_MCQ','K10_WRTHLSS_MCQ','K10_FLING_MCQ','K10_FLINGLESS_MCQ','K10_FLINGMORE_MCQ','K10_UNWK_NB_MCQ','K10_HFWK_NB_MCQ','K10_DOC_NB_MCQ','K10_OTPFLING_MCQ','K10_OTPFLING_OTSP_MCQ','K10_PHYSHLTH_MCQ','DEP_DPSFD_COM','DEP_NBRMIS_COM','DEP_CESD10_COM','DEP_BOTR_COM','DEP_MIND_COM','DEP_FLDP_COM','DEP_FFRT_COM','DEP_HPFL_COM','DEP_FRFL_COM','DEP_RSTLS_COM','DEP_HAPP_COM','DEP_LONLY_COM','DEP_GTGO_COM','SLS_LIFE_COM','SLS_LIFENEG_COM','SLS_LIFEPOS_COM','SLS_COND_COM','SLS_CONDNEG_COM','SLS_CONDPOS_COM','SLS_SATS_COM','SLS_SATSNEG_COM','SLS_SATSPOS_COM','SLS_IMP_COM','SLS_IMPNEG_COM','SLS_IMPPOS_COM','SLS_OVER_COM','SLS_OVERNEG_COM','SLS_OVERPOS_COM','SLS_DSCR_COM','SLS_DLIFE_COM','SLS_DCOND_COM','SLS_DSATS_COM','SLS_DIMP_COM','SLS_DOVER_COM','SLS_DCLS_COM','COG_REYI_SCORE_COM','COG_REYII_SCORE_COM','COG_ANML_COM','COG_ANMLRPT_COM','COG_AFT_SCORE_1_COM','COG_AFT_SCORE_2_COM','COG_MAT_SCORE_COM'))
CoP4_Baseline <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'CoP4_Baseline')

# CLSA-COP1
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'CoP_FU1', 'CLSA_1.CoP_FU1', variables = 
list('K10_TIRED_COF1','K10_NRVS_COF1','K10_NRVSCLMD_COF1','K10_HPLS_COF1','K10_RSTLS_COF1','K10_RSTLSSTL_COF1','K10_DEP_COF1','K10_EFFRT_COF1','K10_NOCHRUP_COF1','K10_WRTHLSS_COF1','K10_FLING_COF1','K10_FLINGLESS_COF1','K10_FLINGMORE_COF1','K10_UNWK_NB_COF1','K10_HFWK_NB_COF1','K10_DOC_NB_COF1','K10_OTPFLING_COF1','K10_PHYSHLTH_COF1','DEP_BOTR_COF1','DEP_MIND_COF1','DEP_FLDP_COF1','DEP_FFRT_COF1','DEP_HPFL_COF1','DEP_FRFL_COF1','DEP_RSTLS_COF1','DEP_HAPP_COF1','DEP_LONLY_COF1','DEP_GTGO_COF1','SLS_LIFE_COF1','SLS_LIFENEG_COF1','SLS_LIFEPOS_COF1','SLS_COND_COF1','SLS_CONDNEG_COF1','SLS_CONDPOS_COF1','SLS_SATS_COF1','SLS_SATSNEG_COF1','SLS_SATSPOS_COF1','SLS_IMP_COF1','SLS_IMPNEG_COF1',
'SLS_IMPPOS_COF1','SLS_OVER_COF1','SLS_OVERNEG_COF1','SLS_OVERPOS_COF1','LONE_OFTN_COF1','LONE_LEFT_COF1','LONE_ISOL_COF1')) 
CoP_FU1 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'CoP_FU1')
```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
mho_CLSA_cop0 <- data.frame(id = CoP4_Baseline$id)
mho_CLSA_cop1 <- data.frame(id = CoP_FU1$id)

# When you are done with your work, logout of Opal server
opal.logout(erasmus_opal)
```

### **Variable label**:   Feels anxious or nervous  
**Variable name**:   psy_anxious_yn_0  
**Variable description**:  Single item question on whether the participant feels anxious or nervous.  
**Value type**:  integer    
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |   Does not feel anxious or nervous
1 |   Feels anxious or nervous

**Harmonization status**: complete   
**Harmonization comment**:  Based on a 5-point ('all of the time', 'most of the time', 'some of the time', 'a little of the time', 'none of the time') item response to "During the past 30 days, about how often did you feel nervous?" from the K10 psychological distress scale. Participants who responded 'all of the time' or 'most of the time' were defined as feeling anxious or nervous.     
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
mho_CLSA_cop0$psy_anxious_yn_0 <- as.integer(ifelse(CoP4_Baseline$K10_NRVS_MCQ <= 2,1, ifelse(CoP4_Baseline$K10_NRVS_MCQ >= 3,0,NA)))

```

# Cognitive functioning subdomain

### **Variable label**:  Immediate word recall 
**Variable name**:  cog_imm_rscale_0  
**Variable description**:  Rescaled value (ranging from 0 to 10) of the total number of words immediately recalled during a test of verbal memory. If the test is performed more than once, data are based on the first trial.  
**Value type**:  integer    
**Variable unit**:  words  
**Category coding**:  N/A 

**Harmonization status**: complete   
**Harmonization comment**:  Immediate word recall of 15 words from Rey's Auditory Verbal Learning Test was performed in CLSA. Only one trial of immediate word recall was assessed. The number of words immediately recalled were rescaled from 0-15 to 0-10 in CLSA.        
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
CoP4_Baseline$COG_REYI_SCORE_COM <- as.numeric(CoP4_Baseline$COG_REYI_SCORE_COM)

mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_imm_rscale_0 <- rescale(CoP4_Baseline$COG_REYI_SCORE_COM, to = c(0,10), from = c(0,15))

mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_imm_rscale_0 <- as.integer(round(mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_imm_rscale_0))

```

### **Variable label**:  Low immediate word recall     
**Variable name**:  cog_imm_low_0    
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant has low immediate word recall using a median split on the total (rescaled) number of words immediately recalled. If the test is performed more than once, data are based on the first trial.   
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A   
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |   High immediate word recall  
1 |   Low immediate word recall

**Harmonization status**: complete   
**Harmonization comment**:  This was based on the number of words immediately recalled from CLSA, which was rescaled from 0-15 to 0-10.    
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_imm_low_0 <- as.integer(dicho(mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_imm_rscale_0, dich.by = "median", as.num = FALSE, var.label = NULL, val.labels = NULL, append = FALSE, suffix = NULL))

mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_imm_low_0 <- as.integer(car::recode(mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_imm_low_0, "2=0"))

```

**Variable name**:  cog_verb_std_0  
**Variable description**:  Standardised value (z-score) of the total number of correctly named words from the given category (animals). If the test is performed more than once, data are based on the first trial.

### **Variable label**:  Processing speed  
**Variable name**:  cog_proc_std_0  
**Variable description**:  Standardised value (z-score) of the total number of items recalled correctly in a processing speed task. If the test is performed more than once, data are based on the first trial.    
**Value type**:  decimal      
**Variable unit**: items  
**Category coding**:  N/A  

**Harmonization status**: complete    
**Harmonization comment**:  Processing speed was measured using the Mental Alternation Test (MAT). Participants were asked to count from 1-20 in 30 seconds and to recite the alphabet in 30 seconds. Participants were only asked to take the MAT if they were able to complete these two sub-tasks. The MAT asked participants to alternate consecutive numbers and letters from 1-A to 26-Z in 30 seconds. MAT scores (0-52) were based on the sum of each correct number and letter recited in a consecutive order, which were transformed to z-scores.       
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_proc_std_0 <- scale(CoP4_Baseline$COG_MAT_SCORE_COM)

```

mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_del_std_0 <- scale(mho_CLSA_cop0$cog_del_rscale_0)
